Russia: Russia invaded the Ottoman provinces of Wallachia and Moldavia.
Crimean War: The Ottoman Empire declared war on Russia.
Philippine: Ramón Montero y Blandino appointed Governor-General (1853–1854)
Malta: The Crimean War; Malta serves as a hospital base for wounded combatants, and acquires the nickname Nurse of the Mediterranean. (to 1856)
Malaysia: Alan Lee, officer in charge of another fort at Nanga Lingga, Sri Aman was defeated and killed by Rentap.
Japan: Matthew C. Perry arrives off the coast of Japan in four ships. Perry orders harbor buildings to be shelled to force negotiations for a letter President Millard Fillmore sent to the ruler of Japan. This incident was coined as the "Arrival of the Black Ships" in Japanese history.
India: First Railway estalblished between Bombay and Thane
Cuba: José Martí is born in Havana.
Colombia: José María Obando is President of the Republic of New Granada
Manuel María Mallarino is President of the Republic of New Granada
Belgium: Marriage of Leopold, Duke of Brabant, heir to the Belgian throne, and Marie Henriette of Austria.
Australia: First paddle steamers on Murray River on the spring flood. From South Australia, the Lady Augusta captained by Francis Cadell, reached Swan Hill while Mary Ann captained by William Randell, made it as far as Moama (near Echuca).
Bendigo Petition and Red Ribbon Rebellion at Bendigo
Argentina: Constitution of Argentina agreed by assembly in Santa Fe, creating modern system of government
